inputs.description: Duplicate the element before showing it. This is to test NI_duplicate function.
inputs.name: DUP

inputs.description: Show header parts only in output
inputs.name: NODATA

inputs.description: Dump the value of attribute ATTR
inputs.name: ATTRIBUTE

inputs.description: If MATCH is exact, then attribute name is matched exactly. If MATCH is partial, then a match of all the characters in ATTR is enough. For example, an ATTR of COEF would match any of COEF COEF.1 COEF.2, etc. Default is -match exact
inputs.name: MATCH

inputs.description: streamspec is a filename (last option on the command line)
inputs.name: F

inputs.description: streamspec is an element string like: '<T font=9 coords="2.3 23 2"/>' (last option on the command line)
inputs.name: S

inputs.description: write elements to stdout (default), instead of stderr
inputs.name: STDOUT

inputs.description: write elements to stderr, instead of stdout -#: put the # at the beginning of lines with no data (default)
inputs.name: STDERR

inputs.description: -No#: Do not put the # at the beginning of lines with no data
inputs.name: NO

inputs.description: quiet stderr messages, and don't echo attribute name with -attribute option
inputs.name: QUIET

inputs.description: Only output elements that have an attribute ATTR of value ATTRVAL. a status of 1 is returned if no match is found.
inputs.name: FIND_NEL_WITH_ATTR

inputs.description: Do not output elements that have an attribute ATTR of value ATTRVAL.
inputs.name: SKIP_NEL_WITH_ATTR

inputs.description: Don't wait on a stream for more than MAX_WAIT before you receive an element. Default is 100 msec. Set MAX_WAIT to -1 to wait forever and a day niprobe returns a status of 0 if it the stream opened. and there were no interruptions.
inputs.name: MW
